results.title: Hoop culture
results.brief_description: Created in response to a class assignment to offer a visual interpretation of ‘cultural identity’, this short After Effects animation focuses itself on different aspects of the ‘hoop culture’ of amateur basketball around melbourne.

results.title: Caffe Amore
results.brief_description: Two strangers from across a crowded cafe, are they destined or is their love doomed from the start. A frothy romance.

results.title: The Pier
results.brief_description: Short film shot 1990 on Super 8 Film of St Kilda Pier (burnt down 2003). Filmed early in the morning, the moody feel of the work is heightened by atmospheric soundtrack (added by ACMI) Captures the shared experience of a morning spent at this popular spot for St Kilda residents.

results.title: Billycarts
results.brief_description: This evocative silent home movie footage shows kids playing in a billycart in the drive-way and on the street, and creates a strong nostalgia for long ago youth. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Maroondah Dam
results.brief_description:
Silent 1950s home movie footage of a family outing to the Maroondah Dam in the Upper Yarra Valley. Includes images of the landscape and boating facilities. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
results.description:

results.title: Phantom
results.brief_description: This video work is a mysterious, ghostly geography of cinematic shadows. Silhouettes that never quite take shape shift and glide across the screen, anaemic figures, seen in the negative, forced to wander between narratives restlessly but caught in a loop. These remnants from faint memories of filmic melodrama are a living dead confined to a space they cannot leave. They are the secret that lies between stories.

results.title: Time-lapse footage of decomposing rat
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description: Remarkable time-lapse sequence depicting the natural decomposition of a dead rat. Produced by Oxford Scientific Films, this footage is as elegant as it is grotesque.
results.description: Remarkable time-lapse sequence depicting the natural decomposition of a dead rat. Produced by Oxford Scientific Films, this footage is as elegant as it is grotesque.

results.title: Psycho samba
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: ‘Suddenly a bolt of electricity sprang forth from the screen and hit me in the head, scorching my forehead with uncanny resemblance of a burn that looked like a human eye. I could hear a buzzing in my ears, my newly formed third eye then began to secrete a special metallic-tasting liquid, as I saw visions of atomic bomb mushroom clouds.’ - Ian Haig (Chicago Underground Film Fest)
